properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLR REAR APARTMENT MISSING C/O DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR AND BASEMENT APARTMENT-MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT APARTMENT/MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3001 W. /APT. 1 - SMOKE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 3001 W. /APT. 1 - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SOUTH WEST PARTIALLY ENCLOSED PORCH - DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS.  ROTTING COLUMNS AT BASE AND AT VARIOUS LOCATION THROUGHOUT PORCH.  SEVERAL COLUMNS SEATED ON CONCRETE SLAB, NO PIERS VISIBLE.  COLUMN FURTHEST SOUTH EAST IS SIGNIFICANTLY NOTCHED IN CENTER WITH NO OTHER WOOD MEMBER SECURED IN NOTCH,  COLUMN IS COMPROMISED.  RISER HEIGHTS ON PORCH VARY FROM 5'' TO 8 1/2''.  BUTT JOINT COLUMN TO BEAM, AND COLUMN TO JOIST CONNECTIONS.  ROTTING JOISTS THROUGHOUT.  2X6 JOISTS SPAN OVER 12' AND ARE SIGNIFICANTLY SAGGING.  DECKS AND JOISTS DEFLECT.  JOISTS WITH NO BEAM/ HEADER AT 2 UNDER ENCLOSED SECTION OF PORCH.  BEAMS, COLUMNS, RAILS, STRINGERS, ALL MEMBERS ANCHORE WITH NAILS ONLY.  ROTTING DECKS.  ROTTING AND CRACKED STRINGERS.  ROTING AND LOOSE, DEFLECTING RAILS.  ROTTING PORCH ROOF DECKING.  ROTTING AND LOOSE SECTIONS OF ENCLOSURE.  OBTAIN COMPLETE PLAN AND PERMIT.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Failed to rebuild or replace dilapidated and dangerous porch.  (13-196-570, 13-196-641)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: EAST PARTIALLY ENCLOSED PORCH- LOOSE AND DEFLECTING RAILS.  RAILS IN ENCLOSED PORTION INSTALLED ON TOP OF DECKING AND DEFLECT SEVERELY.  2X8 JOISTS SPAN 11' 6'' INSTALLED AT 16'' ON CENTER.  4X6 LOOKOUT BEAMS SPAN 7' 5''.  SOUTHEAST AND NORTHEAST 6X6 COLUMNS ARE NOTCHED FOR LOOKOUJT BEAMS AND THEN HAVE A BUTT JOINT COLUMN SPLICE DIRECTLY ABOVE.  STRINGERS FROM 2 TO 3 ANCHORED WITH NAILS ONLY.  STAIRS FROM 2 TO 3 WITH ONLY 27'' WIDTH.  ROTTING PORCH ROOF DECKING.  OLDER JOIST WITH NEW SISTERED JOIST UNDER 2 ROTTING.  ROOF STRUCTURE EXTENDS PAST ENCLOSURE AND PAST COLUMNS 8' WITH A KNEE BRACE, WHICH KICKS OUT FROM COLUMN AND EXTENDS OUT ONLY 4', AS SUPPORT FOR THE RIM JOIST.  OBTAIN COMPLETE PLAN AND PERMIT (INCLUDE PORCH ROOF).

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO SMOKE DETECTORS TOPS OF REAR PORCHES IN ENCLOSED PORTIONS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.
